image.altText: An older man in a hard hat and an orange Hi-Vis vest stands on a dock in front of the water.

props.synopsis: The project to deliver new Spirit of Tasmania vessels has led to another resignation at ferry operator TT-Line, chief executive Bernard Dwyer, who was absent at a parliamentary inquiry today.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania saga claims a third high-ranking official, as chief executive Bernard Dwyer resigns

props.synopsis:
In the United States, Americans can split or average out their income with their partner to reduce the tax they pay. Could this be adopted in Australia?

title.children: 'So blatant it's bordering on laughable': Family trust accounts minimise tax, so why can't couples have a joint tax return?

image.altText: A close up of Nicki Hutley sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: It's not just older generations who think younger people are doing it tough. The list of people concerned about the impact of inflation on households includes economists, the boss of the Commonwealth Bank, Matt Comyn, and the Reserve Bank.

title.children: 'You can't blame the boomers': The generational divide behind Australia's cost of living split

image.altText: Smiling man in a suit, stands holding the budget paper for 2023

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Treasurer Michael Ferguson announces a record $5.1 billion infrastructure spend days out from this year's state budget, despite a warning from an independent review.

image.altText: Brett Andrew Button faced court for the first time

props.synopsis: Judge Roy Ellis tells a Newcastle court the coming days of victim impact statements will be emotional as "never before have so many people been killed and injured in a single motor vehicle incident".

title.children: Judge warns 'unprecedented' sentencing hearing for Hunter Valley bus crash driver will be highly emotional

image.altText: Two workers in Hi-Vis on a crane working on a powerline.

props.synopsis: More financial assistance has opened up for Tasmanians affected by the recent storm and flooding event, as residents continue assessing the damage.

title.children: 'Unprecedented scale of damage': Disaster relief grants of up to $10,000 announced by Tasmanian premier

title.children: Australia could be ready to say goodbye to negative gearing

image.altText: A tall apartment building, seen from below.

props.synopsis: Israeli strikes on Syria's Hama countryside, including at a chemical weapons plant, kill at least four civilians, according to Syrian state media.

title.children: Israel carries out deadly strikes in Syria

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis:
Australia's largest strata title insurer Steadfast has halted trading on the ASX after a sharp decline in its share price in response to a 4C's investigation, while the market drops 0.8pc on opening.

Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX opens 0.8pc lower, Steadfast tumbles then halts trading after Four Corners investigation

image.altText: Three firefighters stand on the footpath near a red fire truck, looking towards a brick house with police tape across it.

image.altText: A snowboarder smiling at the camera with gumtrees and snowy mountains behind them.

image.altText: A vividly-coloured wasp on a twig.

image.altText: A hiker looks over a cleared area.
